RautSoft.econometrics.dataset
Class Dataset

java.lang.Object
  RautSoft.econometrics.dataset.Dataset
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class Dataset
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable

Dataset is a basic data factory class, which prepares data to be used for any data analysis, such as XYDataset for general econometrics. An instance of this class (i.e., an object of this type) is the basic object of any data analysis that needs. Each record is a 1-D double array of fixed size k. Records are stored in an ArrayList. Various methods of the class include getXYDataset(yViable index, int [] xVarIndex) which could be then passed to the constructors of Econometrics objects of the type MaximumLikelihood, Regress, Tobit, Probit, Logit. The constructors of these Econometric classes require data in the y as dependent variable, and a set of other x-variables as independent variables.

Example of use:


        String infile="C:\\MyProjects\\stat\\src\\Exercises\\data.dat";
       // This file should have multiple of d numbers

        Dataset data = new Dataset(infile,3); //the paramter 3 indicates the number of variables
        data.setVLabel(new String[] {"IQ", "Height", "Food"});
        data.setVName(new String[] {"X1", "X2", "X3"});
        System.out.println(data);
        System.out.println(data.print() );

        XYDataset temp=data.getXYDataset(1, new int[]{0,2});
        Regress  reg =new Regress(temp);
        // above two statements could be combined as
        //Regress reg = new Regress(data.getXYDataset(1, new int[]{0,2}));
        reg.Compute();
        System.out.println(reg.getOutput() );
        System.out.println(reg.getLogs() );

Version:
1.0
Author:
Lakshmi K. Raut

Dataset

public Dataset(double[][] data)
Dataset constructor. Input is a double array. automatically creates variable lables and variable names, both as Var[0]....Var[k-1], wehre k is the number of variables

Parameters:
data - is a double array double [][] columns as variables and rows as records

Dataset

               int k)
Creates the dataset from a valid filename, such as c:\\dir1\\fn.dat.

Parameters:
fileName - A String containing filename such as c:\\dir1\\fn.dat.
k - number of variables, total number of entries should be multiple of this number.

public XYDataset getXYDataset(int yIndex,
                              int[] xIndex)

Parameters:

addArrayRecords

public void addArrayRecords(double[][] recordsToAdd)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Adds an array of records of same type, i.e., each record should be a 1-D array of doubles of same size as in the dataset.

Parameters:
recordsToAdd - the list name whose contents to be added, a List object
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of columns of the array does not conform to the number of variables in the dataset
